newsitem.title: UK: Abbey says increases mortgage, savings rates.
newsitem.headline: Abbey says increases mortgage, savings rates.

text.p: Britain's Abbey National said on Tuesday it was raising mortgage interest rates by 0.31 percentage points with effect from June 1.
The rate rise follows the decision by Britain's new Labour government to lift UK base rates to 6.25 percent from 6.0 percent announced earlier in the day.
From June, interest rates on loans of up to 59,999 pounds ($97,000) rise to 7.60 percent, from 60,000 to 99,999 pounds to 7.55 percent and over 100,000 pounds to 7.50 percent.
Abbey said it would be announcing new savings rates shortly.
Earlier Halifax Building Society said it was raising its UK mortgage rates to 7.6 percent from 7.25 percent.
Other mortgage lenders said they were keeping rates under review.
